chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean L Bishop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

supervisions.notes:
Court grants Huber.
Consecutive to: case number 14CM520

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must report to probation by 3:00 PM on Friday, May 8, 2015.

05/18/2015 AMENDED FROM 2 YEARS OF PROBATION TO 1 YEAR OF PROBATION. 

Concurrent with: case number 14CM520

miscConds.notes:
$500.00 cash bond to be applied. 
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must participate in Barron County Restorative Justice Programming.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean L Bishop

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 5/12/15 Letter to Judge Babler from Department of Corrections regarding count four sentence.
to amend judgment of conviction (letter form).

Defendant Sean L Bishop in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF75 and 14CM520. 
State relates agreement. Victim impact statement filed. 
14CM520 - Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
15CF75 - Defendant pleads guilty to Count 5. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Court orders all other counts to be dismissed and read-in. 

Court relates and orders: 
14CM520:
IMPOSED and STAYED. 
60 days jail with Huber - STAYED
2 Years Probation - IMPOSED
Must participate in Barron County Restorative Justice Programming. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. 
$500.00 cash bond to be applied. 
Firearm to be forfeited. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

15CF75:
IMPOSED and STAYED. 
60 days jail with Huber - Consecutive to 14CM520 - STAYED. 
2 Years Probation - Concurrent to 14CM520 - IMPOSED.  
Must participate in Barron County Restorative Justice Programming. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. 
$500.00 cash bond to be applied. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

Must sign up for probation by 3:00 PM on Friday, May 8, 2015.

Defendant Sean L Bishop in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CM520 and 15CF75 called.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Sean L Bishop in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 3:45: Sergeant Andrew Krahenbuhl with the City of Rice Lake called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. 3:51: Cross by Defense. Defense makes argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives formal reading and elects to stand mute. Court enters NG pleas to all counts. 
14CM520 to be moved from 2/18/15 to April 1, 2015 to track along with this case.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not possess firearms.
Must submit PBTs at Rice Lake Police Department daily at 6:00 p.m.

Defendant Sean L Bishop in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Sean L Bishop in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
